subject: Learning
title: Adaptive Strategy Use
description: A short lesson to help you apply Adaptive Strategy Use.

hook.text: Flashcards work great for vocabulary but terribly for essay writing. Smart learners switch tools.

buildup.text: Different tasks demand different strategies. A one-size-fits-all approach wastes effort.

discovery.text: Adaptive learners match strategy to task: retrieval for facts, elaboration for concepts, practice for skills.

twist.text: Most students use the same strategy for everything because nobody taught them alternatives.

climax.text: Building a toolkit of strategiesâ€”and knowing when to deploy eachâ€”is the hallmark of expert learners.

punchline.text: Don't use a hammer for every problem. Learn to pick the right tool.

quiz.question: What characterizes adaptive strategy use?
options: Matching the learning strategy to the specific demands of the task
Using the same strategy for all subjects
Avoiding all study strategies in favor of intuition
